intro: Cousinia abolinii, commonly known as the Afghan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly Afghanistan and Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. It features slender, erect stems and small, yellowish to brownish flower heads that bloom in summer. Cousinia abolinii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
